title: Pizza Delivery Boy Stabs Woman 14 Times Over Rs 170 Tip. Victim Later Finds Out She's Pregnant - News18
Vladimir Putin Predicts Russia Will Win Ukraine War In 2025: 'God Is With Us' - News18
summary:
Vladimir Putin Predicts Russia Will Win Ukraine War In 2025: 'God Is With Us'

Date: December 27, 2024

Source: News18

In a statement made at the Supreme Eurasian Economic Council meeting, President Vladimir Putin expressed confidence that Russia would achieve victory in the ongoing conflict with Ukraine by 2025, emphasizing that divine support is on their side.

  • Putin stated, “I believe in God. And God is with us.”
  • He rejected a US proposal to freeze the conflict, recalling that a similar deal was previously deemed unacceptable by Moscow.
  • Moscow aims to successfully conclude the Ukraine war while addressing economic and social issues.
  • Putin showed openness to Slovakian-led peace talks to potentially resolve the conflict.
“We are striving to end the conflict. We believe that we will be successful on the front line.”

Putin's assertions highlight the ongoing tensions in the region and the geopolitical complexities surrounding the Ukraine conflict.
newTitle: Putin Claims Victory in Ukraine War by 2025, Asserts Divine Support

title: Driver who killed 35 in China car ramming sentenced to death - DAWN.com
summary:
Man Sentenced to Death for China Car Ramming Attack that Killed 35

Publication Date: Today, Source: State Media

A man who deliberately drove through a crowd of people exercising outside a sports complex in Zhuhai, China, killing 35, has been sentenced to death. The 62-year-old, Fan Weiqiu, was found guilty of venting his anger over a broken marriage and personal frustrations. The attack, which occurred on November 11, was the deadliest in China since 2014.

  1. The defendant was tried and sentenced on the same day, with the court citing the extreme nature of the crime and its severe consequences.
  2. Fan pleaded guilty in front of victims' families, officials, and members of the public.
  3. The attack has sparked anger and discussion online, with some calling for immediate execution.
Fan decided to vent his anger over a broken marriage and personal frustrations, leading to the deadly attack.

The sentencing comes amid a string of mass casualty incidents in China this year, challenging the country's reputation for good public security.
newTitle: Man Sentenced to Death for China Car Ramming Attack that Killed 35

title: German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier dissolves parliament, calls early election for February 23 after - The Times of India
summary:
German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier dissolves parliament, calls early election for February 23 after Scholz's coalition falls apart

Publication Date: Not provided

Source: Not provided

An abrupt political shift in Germany has occurred as President Frank-Walter Steinmeier dissolves parliament, prompting early elections set for February 23. This decision follows the collapse of Chancellor Olaf Scholz's coalition government.

  • President Steinmeier's decision came after internal disagreements led to the disintegration of the ruling coalition.
  • The German public now faces an unexpected early election, providing an opportunity for reevaluation of political alliances.
  • This event marks a significant moment in German politics, impacting future governance and policy direction.
“The stability of our government is paramount for the future of Germany.” - President Frank-Walter Steinmeier

This early election underscores the volatility in German politics and the necessity for a stable governing coalition moving forward.
newTitle: German President Calls Early Election After Coalition Collapse

title: "External Interference" Caused Plane Crash In Kazakhstan: Azerbaijan Airlines - NDTV
summary:
Kazakhstan Plane Crash Linked to External Interference, Says Azerbaijan Airlines

Date: Not specified Source: NDTV

Azerbaijan Airlines stated that "external physical and technical interference" was responsible for a tragic plane crash in Kazakhstan that resulted in 38 fatalities out of 67 passengers.

  • The Embraer 190 aircraft diverted and crashed in Aktau, Kazakhstan, after being denied landing in Grozny due to fog.
  • There are reports suggesting a possible accidental missile strike from Russian air defenses.
  • An investigation is ongoing, with evidence of missile damage noted by experts.
  • A passenger reported a loud bang before the aircraft began to behave erratically.
  • Azerbaijan Airlines announced the suspension of flights to multiple Russian airports for safety reasons.
“I thought the plane was going to fall apart,” - Subhonkul Rakhimov, passenger.

The situation around the crash emphasizes the ongoing tensions involving air travel and defense systems in politically sensitive regions.
newTitle: Kazakhstan Plane Crash Linked to External Interference, Says Azerbaijan Airlines

title: Akin To B-21 Raider’s Broad-Spectrum Stealth, China’s New 6th-Gen Stealth Fighters Bound To Rattle U.S. Military - EurAsian Times
summary:
China Unveils New 6th-Generation Stealth Fighters

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Eurasian Times

China has recently unveiled two new stealth fighter prototypes, featuring broad-spectrum stealth technology that enhances their ability to evade radar detection across various frequencies.

  • Broad-spectrum stealth minimizes detectability to both high and low-frequency radars.
  • This technology was previously seen only in strategic bombers, marking a significant leap for fighter jets.
  • The introduction of these fighters positions China ahead in global stealth capabilities.
  • The larger fighter, possibly the J-36, has enhanced payload capacity and stealth features.
  • The smaller fighter, likely from SAC, is designed for agility and air superiority roles.
  • Capabilities of the new fighters may include optional manning and next-generation power plants.
“China’s rapid advancement in military aviation technology is unquestionable.”

The prototypes reveal China's significant progress in military technology but actual capabilities will be assessed as they develop further.
newTitle: China Unveils New 6th-Generation Stealth Fighters, Advancing Military Aviation Technology

title: MAGA crowd demands no H-1B visas for Indians, Vivek Ramaswamy says American parents raising their kids wrong - India Today
summary:
MAGA supporters call for H-1B visa freeze as Vivek Ramaswamy blames American parenting for STEM shortfall

Published On: Dec 27, 2024 | Published By: Nandini Yadav

The debate over H-1B visas has reignited as Trump supporters demand a halt to hiring foreign skilled workers. Vivek Ramaswamy argues the real issue lies in American culture and parenting.

  • Trump supporters are pushing for a complete freeze on H-1B visas for skilled workers.
  • Vivek Ramaswamy attributes the STEM workforce shortfall to American parenting practices.
  • He contrasts the cultural values of immigrant families with those of mainstream American culture.
  • Critics accuse Ramaswamy of undermining American workers' concerns.
  • The H-1B visa debate highlights tensions between low-cost foreign labor and domestic job security.
The reason top tech companies often hire foreign-born & first-generation engineers over “native” Americans isn’t because of an innate American IQ deficit... — Vivek Ramaswamy

Ramaswamy's comments have sparked significant backlash, highlighting the cultural divide in America's approach to education and success.
newTitle: MAGA supporters call for H-1B visa freeze as Vivek Ramaswamy blames American parenting for STEM shortfall

summary:
Banned outfits provided with sanctuaries, support on Afghan territory: ISPR

Date: September 30, 2023 | Source: Dawn

Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR) Director General Lieutenant General Ahmed Sharif Chaudhry highlighted the ongoing support and activities of terrorist outfits in Afghanistan, expressing concerns over increased security threats in Pakistan.

  • Record-high number of terrorists killed in 2024, highest in 5 years.
  • Pakistan expresses reservations regarding sanctuaries given to terrorists in Afghanistan.
  • Recent increase in attacks targeting security forces in Balochistan and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.
  • Ongoing counterterrorism operations are ongoing with significant daily engagements.
  • Repatriation of illegal Afghan citizens from Pakistan is in progress.
“All evidence related to terrorism can be traced back to the safe havens enjoyed by terrorists in Afghanistan.” - Gen Chaudhry

The ISPR emphasizes a commitment to counterterrorism, urging for a cohesive approach to manage and prevent violence spilling over from Afghanistan into Pakistan.
newTitle: Banned Outfits in Afghanistan: ISPR Addresses Support and Security Concerns

title: Military says no political leader's ambition above welfare of Pakistan - The News International
summary:
Military emphasizes national welfare over political ambitions in Pakistan

Date: December 27, 2024

Source: The News

In a recent briefing, ISPR DG Lieutenant General Ahmed Sharif Chaudhry asserted that no political leader's ambitions supersede the welfare of Pakistan.

  • The military clarified its stance against any political leader's ambition that might undermine the country's interests.
  • General Chaudhry noted the importance of dialogue among politicians for resolving their issues.
  • He reported a significant rise in counter-terrorism operations, with over 59,779 intelligence-based operations carried out in the past year.
  • The military has emphasized its neutrality and professional relations with all political parties.
  • Pakistan's military readiness in the face of regional tensions, particularly with India, was reaffirmed.
  • He condemned brutality against freedom movements in India and highlighted the military's commitment to supporting the Kashmir cause.
"No individual, his politics and his desire for power are above Pakistan." - ISPR DG Lt Gen Ahmed Sharif Chaudhry

The military spokesperson emphasized a united effort against terrorism and reiterated the army's engagement in public welfare and national development initiatives.
newTitle: Military emphasizes national welfare over political ambitions in Pakistan

title: No political leader's desire for power should surpass Pakistan's interests: ISPR DG - Geo News
summary:
No Political Leader's Desire for Power Should Surpass Pakistan's Interests: ISPR DG

Date: December 27, 2024 Source: Geo News

Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR) Director General Lieutenant General Ahmed Sharif Chaudhry emphasized during a briefing that Pakistan's interests should take precedence over any political leader's ambitions, advocating for dialogue among political parties.

  • All political parties and leaders are respected by the army.
  • Welcoming dialogue among politicians to solve issues.
  • Accountability for any officer prioritizing politics over the state.
"For every army officer, the state of Pakistan and the army hold priority."

The ISPR DG highlighted the need for accountability and integrity within the Pakistan Army while reiterating support for national unity and counter-terrorism efforts.

title: FBI ‘Found Covid Was Leaked From China Lab’ But Joe Biden Was Kept In Dark: Report - News18
summary:
FBI ‘Found Covid Was Leaked From China Lab’ But Joe Biden Was Kept In Dark: Report

Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: News18

The FBI is reported to have found evidence suggesting that Covid-19 leaked from a Chinese lab, but the findings were excluded from a report sent to President Joe Biden. This raises concerns about transparency and the influence of intelligence officials over significant scientific inquiries.

  • The FBI allegedly silenced the US defense department and researchers supporting the lab leak theory.
  • Research indicated similarities between Covid-19 and techniques described in a 2008 study from the Wuhan Institute of Virology.
  • Findings that supported the lab leak theory were excluded from an August 2021 report presented to Biden.
  • Federal grant documents detailing virus engineering were improperly classified according to a whistleblower.
  • The WHO and China claimed the virus likely moved from bats to humans via another animal in a 2021 report.
“What ended up on the cutting-room floor needs to be re-examined.” - FBI scientist Jason Bannan

This article highlights the ongoing debate about the origins of the Covid-19 virus and the implications of governmental transparency in scientific investigation.
newTitle: FBI Reportedly Found Covid Was Leaked From China Lab While Biden Remained Uninformed

title: South Korea’s parliament votes to impeach acting president Han - Al Jazeera English
South Korea’s opposition-controlled National Assembly votes to impeach acting leader Han - The Indian Express
summary:
South Korea Impeaches Acting President Han Duck-soo amid Political Crisis

Date: December 2024 | Source: Indian Express

South Korea’s opposition-controlled National Assembly voted Friday to impeach acting President Han Duck-soo, intensifying the nation's political turmoil that began with President Yoon Suk Yeol’s martial law declaration.

  • The National Assembly passed the impeachment motion with a unanimous vote of 192-0.
  • Protests by the governing People Power Party (PPP) ensued, claiming the vote was invalid.
  • Han’s impeachment suspends his presidential powers pending a Constitutional Court decision.
  • The court is reviewing whether to uphold Yoon's impeachment, creating further uncertainty.
  • Han referred to the impeachment as “regrettable,” but will respect the Assembly's decision.
  • Investigations into Yoon's martial law decree and allegations of rebellion are ongoing.
“I will wait for a swift, wise decision by the Constitutional Court.” - Han Duck-soo

The impeachment raises significant questions about South Korea’s political landscape as it navigates crises from multiple fronts.
newTitle: South Korea Impeaches Acting President Han Duck-soo amid Political Crisis

title: Type 076 Sichuan: China Unveils World’s Largest Amphibious Assault Ship With EMALS; Comes After 6th-Gen Aircraft “Debut” - EurAsian Times
summary:
China Launches Type 076 Sichuan, Largest Amphibious Assault Ship

Date: December 27, 2023 | Source: EurAsian Times

The Type 076 amphibious assault ship, named Sichuan, was ceremoniously launched in Shanghai, marking a significant advancement in China's naval capabilities.

  • The vessel is the largest amphibious assault ship globally, with a full displacement of over 40,000 tons.
  • Sichuan integrates cutting-edge technology, featuring twin island superstructures and electromagnetic catapults for aircraft operations.
  • The ship is designed to carry fixed-wing aircraft, helicopters, and amphibious equipment.
  • It will play a vital role in China’s maritime defense strategy, including the use of unmanned aerial vehicles.
  • It has advanced close-in defense systems for protection against aerial threats.
“The Sichuan will enhance the PLA Navy's capacity for amphibious operations, power projection, and quick responses in the region.” - PLA Navy Statement

The launch of the Type 076 Sichuan represents a significant step in China's increasing naval power and capabilities, particularly in amphibious warfare.
newTitle: China Launches Type 076 Sichuan, Largest Amphibious Assault Ship

title: 'You've got to be switched on': Ricky Ponting slams Rohit Sharma's shot selection - The Times of India
'Pathetic. Never happened in the history of Indian cricket': Rohit Sharma destroyed by former BCCI selector MSK Prasad - Hindustan Times
summary:
MSK Prasad Criticizes Rohit Sharma's Captaincy Amidst Poor Performance

Date: Dec 27, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Rohit Sharma faces harsh criticism from former BCCI selector MSK Prasad for his recent performances and captaincy during the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia.

  • Rohit scored just 6, 3, and 10 in his first three innings, emphasizing his underwhelming form.
  • MSK Prasad stated, "It was pathetic. Never happened in the history of Indian cricket that we lost back-to-back three games... he had absolutely no runs in that series."
  • Rohit's captaincy has been criticized for ineffective decisions and poor field placements.
“I personally feel that it has got a direct impact. If the captain comes into some sort of form, that has a direct impact on the side.” - MSK Prasad

The commentary surrounding Rohit Sharma highlights the ongoing struggles within the Indian cricket team, particularly under his leadership, suggesting significant questions about his future as captain.
newTitle: MSK Prasad Criticizes Rohit Sharma's Captaincy Amidst Poor Performance

title: North Korean soldier captured in Russia-Ukraine war dies: Seoul - CNA
summary:
North Korean Soldier Captured in Ukraine Dies of Wounds

Publication Date: December 27, 2023

Source: Channel News Asia

A North Korean soldier, who was captured during the Russia-Ukraine war, has died due to his wounds, according to South Korea's intelligence agency.

  • The soldier was captured by the Ukrainian army and died shortly after his capture.
  • South Korea's National Intelligence Service confirmed the soldier's death.
  • Ukrainian President Zelenskyy stated that nearly 3,000 North Korean soldiers have been killed or wounded in the conflict.
  • Casualty rates are attributed to inexperience in the battlefield and vulnerability to drone attacks.
  • North Korea's military ties with Russia have strengthened since the invasion of Ukraine.
“It has been confirmed through an allied intelligence agency that the North Korean soldier captured alive on Dec 26 has just passed away due to worsening wounds.”

The increasing involvement of North Korean forces in the war has raised alarms from Ukraine and its allies regarding a dangerous expansion of the conflict.
newTitle: North Korean Soldier Captured in Ukraine Dies of Wounds

title: Rohit Sharma's form directly impacting his captaincy: Former chief selector - The Times of India
summary:
Rohit Sharma's Form Affecting His Captaincy, Says Former Chief Selector

Date: New Delhi | Source: Times of India

The performance of Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma has come under scrutiny as his low scores in the ongoing series against Australia reportedly impact his leadership. Former chief selector MSK Prasad highlighted this concern during commentary.

  • Rohit was dismissed for just 3 runs in the Boxing Day Test, continuing a trend of low scores (3, 6, and 10) in the series.
  • MSK Prasad pointed out that Rohit's recent poor form is linked to his captaincy performance.
  • In previous Tests against New Zealand, Rohit had disappointing scores, contributing to a series whitewash.
  • Prasad noted that captaincy requires a player to be in form, and Rohit's recent failures might reflect on how he leads the team.
  • After missing the first Test, Rohit returned but faced challenges with his leadership and decision-making during the matches.
“If a captain comes with some sort of form, that has a direct impact on the side.” - MSK Prasad

Overall, the article suggests that Rohit Sharma's poor batting form is not just a personal issue but one that affects the broader dynamics and performance of the Indian cricket team.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma's Form Affecting His Captaincy, Says Former Chief Selector
